intro: Telipogon ballesteroi, commonly known as the Ballesteroi orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in high-altitude environments. The plant exhibits a unique growth habit, with a short, creeping rhizome and linear, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellow, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telipogon ballesteroi is considered a vulnerable species.
